Description: Fragment of neck and shoulder of East Greek pottery closed vase. Medium-fine, reddish-brown (5 YR 6/4) clay with many white inclusions. Yellowish-brown to dark grey glaze. Interior reserved. Exterior slipped cream; tongues at top of shoulder; worn guilloche on neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

D. Piekarski, "Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akad. Mus. Bonn" in U. Hoeckmann and D.Kreikenbom, Naukratis. Die Beziehungen zu Ostgriechenland, Aegypten und Zypern in archaischer Zeit, Acts of Round Table in Mainz (25-27 November 1999), Bibliopolis 2001, p. 98 pl. 11.2. Piekarski 2001 / p.25 no. A 16 pl. 4.4
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.25 no. A 16 pl. 4.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.455)
